Aight, I'll be honest - I'm a wimpy guy. I hate scary movies, am not a fan of really anything horror-based, and just generally don't like jump scares.

A friend picked up this game & got me to try it out. Took me a while to build up the fortitude to actually play it, but I've gotten fairly addicted to it in the last few weeks. It's entertaining enough; multiplayer shenanigans always have the potential, and this one works (in terms of other players) most of the time. Lot and lots of jump scares, though. Seriously, if you want to wake up in the morning, play a round in the game to get your heart pumping.

It's got a couple of "hooks", as it were. You'll want to upgrade your killer, or get new equipment as a fugitive, or try out new abilities. You'll end up putting a couple bucks into it, to try some of the new characters. Which are worth it, for the most part. Then you'll end up wanting to try more, and sink a couple more bucks into it to buy some of the new characters & killers. Then before you know it, you've spent about the price of a regular game. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Bottom line: entertaining, addictive, skill-dependent, multiplayer, fun, will suck your money if you don't pay attention to your wallet.

Dead By Daylight is an unbalanced yet unique multiplayer horror game that I'm sure was fantastic on paper but turned out to be terrible in practice. First, let me start off with some positives by saying that DBD is a game built off of a very interesting concept. The lore is fascinating and the characters (both survivors and killers) are all fun to play in their own right, and if you ever watched any slasher flick as far back as the 1970's and wanted to experience the world of slasher horror as either a protagonist or antagonist, you'll get your wish here. Atmosphere and lore-wise, the game is good, and there really aren't many other games out there that cover this kind of multiplayer game play...but unfortunately that's about as far as the positives go, which is a real shame.

Truth is, the game just simply doesn't work in so many areas where it should. It is massively unbalanced, with most advantage being given to the survivors while the killers, well...get the short end of the stick, which isn't what you want in a game that is based off of decades of slasher flicks that depict killers as frightening, powerful, and unstoppable. DBD laughs at this and depicts killers as these slow, stupid, and easily foiled map roaming dummies to which the survivors run circles around all the while laughing and taunting because the players playing them know EXACTLY the killer limitations, and most are ridiculous at best and downright unfair at worse.

DBD is more like a parody of the slasher flick genre rather than a genuine experience, and its a shame because there really are some fascinating ideas here. The game just plays far more like a frustrating cat and mouse cartoon rather than something that truly honors the movies its based off of. There's just far to much advantage given to survivors, and not enough given to killers...who are SUPPOSED to be the emboldened ones here, not the survivors. But unfortunately, massive and silly limitations placed on killers makes you feel like a fat, slow, stupid cat trying to catch a fast, clever, evasive mouse who appears to have a never ending supply of tricks up the sleeve to avoid death.

As for the community, I can safely say it is absolutely one of the WORST and TOXIC gaming communities I have ever had the misfortune of encountering in all the years I have been gaming, and this is no understatement. People who play DBD are judgmental, hostile, and cruel, and most seem to enjoy being so. If you're looking for good sportsmanship and gaming maturity, you won't find it here. In fact, it got so bad that I was forced to disable end game chat entirely. On top of this, Behaviour Interactive (the folks who made this game) seem to be more interested in cash grabbing with new content instead of optimizing the product and fixing bugs that have plagued this game from the very beginning.

And so, buy and play at your own risk. If you want to play as survivor you'll have a better time with it (though you'll still complain about a variety of things), but if you want to play as killer, you will get angry and frustrated to the point where you may even quit over it and this, in my opinion, makes DBD a failure for obvious reasons.

게임 자체는 재미가 있는 편이나 그지같은 매칭시스템으로 노랑~초록랭이 보라~빨강 랭을 만나는 일이 자주 있음
이러한 매칭 시스템의 문제로 뉴비 살인마가 퍽 하나와 에드온 없이 살인마를 플레이하면 1명은 커녕 생존자 전원 생존으로 끝남. 하지만 이건 이해라도 할 수 있음. 사람, 유저가 적으니까라는 이유가 있긴함. 
그런데 왜 비추를 하냐? 문제는 뉴비 살인마가 보라~빨강 랭 생존자를 만나면 보라~빨강 랭 애들이 자기 실력으로 따돌리는 줄 알고 티배깅, 후레쉬질을 하는 비매너 행위가 문제임. 전원 생존하면 약올라서 죽을 꺼 같은데, 거기에  출구 앞 티배깅 후 탈출까지 하면 다음 판 더 빡세게 함. 반복하다보면 내가 이걸 왜 화를 내면서 까지 해야하나 라는 생각이 듬. 만약 이 게임을 살 예정이라면 생존자 위주로 플레이 하는 것이 맘이 편함. 티배깅이 가능한 살인마는 고스트페이스, 건슬링거, 피그 이정도 밖에 없으니 기분이라도 덜 상함.

주석- 애초에 살인마가 3인칭이고 생존자가 1인칭으로 나왔어야할 게임임. 생존자가 3인칭으로 시야 볼 거면 심장소리는 도대체 왜 있고 숨소리는 왜 존재하는 거임. 사플 필요 없이 올 거 같은 데만 잘 보면 살인마 그냥 피할 수 있음.  물론 판자 심리전, 창틀 심리전 이해는 하는데 애초에 살인마는 그러한 심리전을 생존자를 각각 2대씩 때린다면 8번 넘게 해야함.

Tja...nach 1000 Stunden sollte ich wohl eine Meinung zu diesem Spiel haben. Es macht mir auch nach so viel Spielzeit genau so viel Spaß, wie am Anfang, wenn nicht sogar noch mehr. Es macht sowohl Spaß als Killer, als auch als Überlebender zu spielen, wobei ich persönlich eher die Killer-Seite bevorzuge. Zwar ist nicht immer alles in diesem Spiel fair und man sollte vielleicht die ein oder andere Sache zumindest ein bisschen verändern, aber wenn man nicht pingelig ist, sollte man darüber hinweg sehen können. Jedenfalls ist Dead by Daylight inzwischen zu meinem liebsten Pc-Spiel geworden und kann es jedem nur ans Herz legen, der Horror gerne hat und ab und an ein wenig fluchen möchte ;)
